result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Charles Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Corey Charles Riley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Corey Charles Riley was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Charles Riley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Corey Charles Riley
Current: PO Box 67, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2016)
Prior: 210 E. South Railroad Street, Kendall, WI 54638

Defendant Corey Charles Riley in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant arrives a bit late, however has now appeared and parties are ready to proceed.  No agreement reached on amounts of restitution.  Court reviews file.  Attorney Raabe advises of items in dispute.  Parties decide items at issue are laptop, software and Rx medication at issue.  State calls L.W., sworn & testifies.  Marked exh. 1.  Identified by witness.  State goes through Rx and laptop cost of $1900.00.  State clarifies amount.  Attorney Raabe cross examines.  Marked exh 2.  Identified by defendant and reviewed.  Attorney Raabe offers exh. 2.  No objection by the State.  Court received exh. 2.  State argues amount of $1814.02 restitution shall be ordered.  Court questions State regarding software.  Attorney Raabe argues laptop, software and medication.  $112.26 agreed upon re: software.  $1133.93 agreed upon from Attorney Raabe for total restitution.  Court orders:  $543.00 for laptop.  Broken laptop not to be given to defendant.  $936.08 for prescription medication costs.  $112.26 for software costs.   $1591.34 total restitution ordered.  $500.00 cash bond to apply to restitution first.   State to prepare an order.  Surcharges to be applied.    ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS.  Ability to pay not at issue.

Defendant Corey Charles Riley in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe states matter is resolved.  State states agreement.  Atty Raabe agrees and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Cash bond to be continued to be held pending completion of the restitution hearing.

Ct 1:  NC - ***w/o repeater
4 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
May serve in Juneau Co if accepted
To commence on or before 4/5/2016 at 6:30 pm
57 days sentence credit to be applied
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Restitution to be determined (Restitution hearing to be set)
Ct 2:  Dismissed

Pre-trial conference at 01-22-2016 10:00 am.
Return date at 02-05-2016 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth filed and approved.  PTC was set, however the DA assigned unable to attend that morning. Request new PTC/RD.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Corey Charles Riley in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Corey Charles Riley in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests another PTC and RD.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference at 11-13-2015 10:15 am.
Return date at 11-25-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Corey Charles Riley appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Adam Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond. File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/Econo Lodge or victim in complaint  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
